title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Sabaragamuwa, Central and Uva provinces after 4.00 p.m.

title: Hurricane Melissa leaves dozens dead and trail of destruction across Caribbean
byline: Hurricane Melissa has continued its devastating sweep across the Caribbean, decimating homes and infrastructure, flooding neighbourhoods and leaving dozens dead.

title: Island-wide anti-drug operation to commence today
byline: The island-wide anti-drug operation is scheduled to commence this morning.

title: Special vessel deployed to rescue fishermen aboard distressed multi-day fishing boat in southeastern seas
byline: A special vessel belonging to the Sri Lanka Navy has been deployed to carry out rescue operations for fishermen aboard a multi-day fishing vessel that met with an accident in the southeastern sea area of the country.

title: Bodies of two unidentified males found in Mattakkuliya
byline: Bodies of two unidentified males have been discovered following information received by the Mattakkuliya Police Station.

title: Donald Trump, Xi Jinping to meet after six years today
byline: US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are set to meet today in Busan on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit, which is a high-stakes encounter unfolding amid escalating trade frictions and global economic uncertainty.

title: Two suspects partially admit involvement in Louvre heist, prosecutor says
byline: Two men arrested in connection with the Louvre theft two weeks ago have “partially recognised” their involvement in the brazen heist, according to officials.

title: GovPay processes over Rs. 500 million in digital payments
byline: GovPay, a secure and user-friendly online platform designed to facilitate digital payments for Sri Lanka’s government services, has successfully processed over Rs. 500 million in transactions, the Ministry of Digital Economy stated.

title: Expressway security operations to be handed over to Rakna Lanka Limited?
byline: The Ministry of Defence has focused on assigning the country’s expressway security operations to Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited (RALL).

title: Sri Lanka’s elderly population increased to 18%
byline: Sri Lanka has been identified as one of the countries in the Asian region with the fastest-growing elderly population, according to health authorities.

title: Navy vessel deployed to rescue fishermen aboard distressed multi-day fishing boat in southeastern seas
byline: A special vessel belonging to the Sri Lanka Navy has been deployed to carry out rescue operations for fishermen aboard a multi-day fishing vessel that met with an accident in the southeastern sea area of the country.

title: Websites disabled in Microsoft global outage come back online
byline: Websites for Heathrow, NatWest and Minecraft returned to service late on Wednesday after experiencing problems amid a global Microsoft outage.

title: China says it’s on track to land astronauts on the moon by 2030 ahead of space station mission
byline: China said Thursday it’s on track to land astronauts on the moon by 2030 as it introduced the next crew of astronauts who will head to its space station as part of the country’s ambitious plans to be a leader in space exploration.

title: ‘Hello Kitty’ movie sets July 2028 release date from Warner Bros
byline: After several years in development, Warner Bros. Animation and New Line Cinema are finally moving ahead with the “Hello Kitty” feature film, dating it for July 21, 2028.

title: Liam Hemsworth leads ‘The Witcher’ in season four ‘refresh’
byline: Netflix fantasy series “The Witcher” returns to screens after more than two years with a new lead actor and a fresh tone, its makers say.

title: 30,000 individuals subjected to inspection during island-wide police operation
byline: A total of 796 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (29).

title: GMOA to launch island-wide trade union action tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch an island-wide trade union action tomorrow (31) in protest against the alleged arbitrary transfer system.

title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers are expected at a few places in the Sabaragamuwa, Central and Uva provinces after 4.00 p.m. today (30), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: New Additional Commissioner General appointed to Motor Traffic Department
byline: Senior officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service Tharaka Niroshan Devapriya today assumed duties as the new Additional Commissioner General of the Motor Traffic Department.

title: Another five persons arrested in Louvre heist investigation
byline: Five new arrests have been made in the investigation into the Louvre jewellery heist, the prosecutor for Paris has said.

title: Chinese gym offers Porsche for losing 50kg in 3 months
byline: A Chinese gym has recently launched a controversial weight-loss challenge, offering a luxury car as a reward to anyone who successfully loses 50kg in three months.

title: Drug menace will be defeated and victory is certain – President
byline: The drug menace must be defeated to ensure social stability in the country and that the steps taken by himself and the government in this regard will undoubtedly lead to victory, according to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Stalemate at Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha continues
byline: A group of members of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha has requested the relevant authorities to convene a meeting to establish the authority of the council, which has not been set up for more than three months.

title: Over Rs. 1.2 billion owed by doctors who have left public service – National Audit Office
byline: The National Audit Office has revealed that the government is owed more than Rs. 1,277 million from medical officers who have left the public service on various grounds.

title: Puma to cut 900 jobs as sales continue to decline
byline: German sportswear maker Puma on Wednesday said that it would cut a further 13% of its workforce globally, equivalent to 900 jobs by the end of 2026, as its sales continued to decline.

title: Trump says will lower China tariffs by 10% after ‘amazing’ meeting with Xi Jinping
byline: Calling it an “amazing” meeting that marked a “fantastic new beginning” in US China relations, US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a sweeping set of economic and trade understandings with Chinese President Xi Jinping...

title: Seven suspects arrested over Weligama PS Chairman’s murder remanded till Nov. 13
byline: Seven suspects, including the gunman arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of Lasantha Wickramasekara, the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha have been remanded until November 13.

title: Three-wheelers, school transport services and taxis to be regulated
byline: Steps are being taken at present to regulate three-wheelers, school transport services and other taxi services, the Chairman of the National Transport Commission (NTC), Eng P.A. Chandrapala stated.

title: 100,000 in Sri Lanka suffer from diabetic ulcers – Health experts
byline: The Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA) has revealed that there are currently around 100,000 patients in the country suffering from diabetic ulcers.

title: Five new suspects arrested over Louvre jewellery theft
byline: Five new arrests have been made in the investigation into the Louvre jewellery heist, the prosecutor for Paris has said.

title: Sri Lanka’s population growing at a slower pace, data suggests
byline: Sri Lanka’s population has been recorded as 21,763,170, according to the 15th Population and Housing Census conducted this year.

title: Evidence examination in case against Diana Gamage commences
byline: The examination of evidence in the case filed by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) against former State Minister Diana Gamage, on charges of submitting false information to the Controller of Immigration and Emigration...

title: We are reforming education system to reduce unnecessary burdens on students: PM Harini
byline: Steps are being taken to gradually reform the education system in a way that reduces unnecessary burdens on students while nurturing citizens capable of contributing to a better world, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: New 24-hour hotline introduced to report drug-related offences
byline: In line with the island-wide anti-drug operation being conducted under the theme “Nation United – National Drive” to eradicate narcotics, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has introduced a new 24-hour hotline.

title: Afghanistan and Pakistan agree to restart peace talks in Istanbul, sources say
byline: Afghanistan and Pakistan will restart peace talks in Istanbul, three sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday, a day after Islamabad said the discussions had ended in failure.

title: Doctors to launch island-wide strike tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association has decided to launch an island-wide strike starting at 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (31).

title: Sri Lankan monk found guilty of sex offences against six girls in Australia
byline: A senior Buddhist monk has been found guilty of historical sex offences against six girls at a Melbourne temple, Australian media reported today.

title: Trump directs nuclear weapons testing to resume for first time in over 30 years
byline: President Donald Trump has called on US military leaders to resume testing US nuclear weapons in order to keep pace with other countries such as Russia and China.

title: Chinese envoy on how expanding RMB cooperation can help Sri Lanka’s economic recovery
byline: At a critical period for Sri Lanka’s economic recovery and structural adjustment, expanding cooperation with China’s renminbi (RMB) will undoubtedly inject fresh momentum into trade facilitation, investment attraction and financial system modernization, says Chinese Ambassador Qi Zhenhong.

title: Five Excise Officers arrested by CID
byline: Five officers of the Narcotics Unit of the Excise Department have been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Israel carries out deadly incursion in south Lebanon
byline: The Israeli military on Thursday (Oct 30) carried out a deadly raid in southern Lebanon, prompting Lebanese President Joseph Aoun to order the army to confront such incursions.
